Customer Service Officer (Machine Maintenance) Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Officer (Machine Maintenance)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary

	We are seeking a proactive Customer Service officer to support our spare parts and service operations.
	The ideal candidate will handle customer communication, coordinate service activities, process quotations and invoices, and ensure timely reporting and documentation.
	Experience in CRM or service coordination will be an added advantage.


Key Responsibilities


	Repair and maintenance Services
	Coordinate after-sales service activities to maintain customer satisfaction.
	Prepare quotations and process orders for spare parts and repairs.
	Handle invoicing and ensure accurate documentation of transactions.
	Follow up with customers on service delivery and payment status.
	Submit periodic reports as required by management.
	Maintain organized filing of all service and sales records.


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND qualification / B.Sc. Degree in Business Administration or a related field
	1 – 2 years of relevant experience in service, sales support, or spare parts operations
	Strong computer skills (MS Office: Excel, Word, Outlook)
	Good communication and organizational abilities
	Experience with CRM tools is an advantage
	Age Range: 18 – 30 Years
	Gender: Male/Female


Salary
N80,000 – N150,000 (Gross) Monthly.

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Title (e.g , Customer Service officer / Machine Maintenance - BO) as the subject of the mail.

  "description": "At Strivo Labs, we are passionate about helping businesses scale with speed and precision. We specialise in providing end-to-end digital solutions, from custom design and MVP development to automation and content creation.

Job Position:&nbsp;UI / UX Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos

About the Role


	We are looking for a passionate UI/UX Engineer to design and implement engaging, user-friendly interfaces across our digital platforms.
	You will collaborate with product managers, designers, and engineers to transform user needs into elegant, scalable, and intuitive solutions.
	The role requires a blend of design sensitivity and front-end engineering skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs.
	Implement responsive, accessible, and pixel-perfect user interfaces using modern web/mobile technologies.
	Ensure consistent brand identity and design systems across all products.
	Conduct user research, usability testing, and gather feedback to iterate on designs and flows.
	Optimize applications for performance, accessibility, and cross-platform compatibility.
	Work closely with backend engineers to integrate APIs and ensure seamless data-driven experiences.
	Stay updated on emerging UI/UX trends, tools, and technologies.
	Contribute to and maintain a scalable design system and component library.


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Computer Science, Design, HCI, or related field (or equivalent experience).
	3+ years of experience in UI/UX design and front-end development.
	Strong proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and modern frameworks (React, Angular, or Vue).
	Proficiency with design and prototyping tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, InVision).
	Solid understanding of responsive design, accessibility (WCAG), and usability principles.
	Experience with version control (Git) and agile development practices.
	Strong portfolio showcasing web/mobile applications with focus on usability and design execution.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience with animation libraries and micro-interactions (e.g., Framer Motion, Lottie).
	Familiarity with user research methods and A/B testing.
	Knowledge of design tokens and component-driven UI development (e.g., Storybook).
	Experience working in fintech/e-commerce/enterprise SaaS would be an advantage


Soft Skills:


	Strong attention to detail with a user-first mindset.
	Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team.
	Openness to feedback and iteration.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, Salary expectations, and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;hiring@strivolabs.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application &ndash; UI/UX Engineer&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

About the Role

	We are looking for a passionate UI/UX Engineer to design and implement engaging, user-friendly interfaces across our digital platforms.
	You will collaborate with product managers, designers, and engineers to transform user needs into elegant, scalable, and intuitive solutions.
	The role requires a blend of design sensitivity and front-end engineering skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs.
	Implement responsive, accessible, and pixel-perfect user interfaces using modern web/mobile technologies.
	Ensure consistent brand identity and design systems across all products.
	Conduct user research, usability testing, and gather feedback to iterate on designs and flows.
	Optimize applications for performance, accessibility, and cross-platform compatibility.
	Work closely with backend engineers to integrate APIs and ensure seamless data-driven experiences.
	Stay updated on emerging UI/UX trends, tools, and technologies.
	Contribute to and maintain a scalable design system and component library.


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Design, HCI, or related field (or equivalent experience).
	3+ years of experience in UI/UX design and front-end development.
	Strong proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and modern frameworks (React, Angular, or Vue).
	Proficiency with design and prototyping tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, InVision).
	Solid understanding of responsive design, accessibility (WCAG), and usability principles.
	Experience with version control (Git) and agile development practices.
	Strong portfolio showcasing web/mobile applications with focus on usability and design execution.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience with animation libraries and micro-interactions (e.g., Framer Motion, Lottie).
	Familiarity with user research methods and A/B testing.
	Knowledge of design tokens and component-driven UI development (e.g., Storybook).
	Experience working in fintech/e-commerce/enterprise SaaS would be an advantage


Soft Skills:


	Strong attention to detail with a user-first mindset.
	Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team.
	Openness to feedback and iteration.


Method of Application

It is a publicly quoted company on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) and serves Nigeria with a wide range of building and construction solutions designed to meet housing and construction needs from small projects like individual home buildings to major construction and infrastructure projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant, HR / IR Manager

Requisition ID: 14044
Job Location: Mfamosing, Cross River

About the Job

	Working with the HR Business Partner, the role provides support in the delivery of the HR agenda to the business. This includes preparing analysis and materials for HR processes e.g. FRC, annual salary review, supporting line managers and acting as assigned Business Partner to certain groups


Responsibilities
What you'll be doing:


	Support the implementation of the annual agenda for HR Strategy in line with the functional plan.
	Support the Plant HRBP in the recruitment of non-cadre staff.
	Maintain the personnel administration/records for the site, ensuring on-time delivery, accuracy of information provided and legal compliance (especially for annual social statements, and individual contracts).

	Work with the Head of HR Industrial and Plant HRBP to identify opportunities and areas of improvement to support improved organisational and people performance.
	Coach and equip supervisors to effectively manage their people in line with people plans e.g. performance management 
	Support production of HR data reporting and analysis to satisfy routine and ad-hoc organisational requirements 
	Working with the Head of HR, Industrial/IR, manage employee and industrial relations for the plant and provide support and guidance to the Plant HRBP.

	Coordinate for PR approvals, delivery schedules, material requirements, and invoice processing.
	Support the Associate Director &ndash; Procurement in executing procurement strategies for Nigeria.

	Verify supplier invoices against POs, delivery notes, and contracts.
	Resolve discrepancies in quantity, pricing, and documentation with vendors and internal teams.

	Basic knowledge of commercial terms, import/export documentation, and taxation (added advantage).
	Strong MS Excel, documentation, and tracking skills.
	Excellent communication and negotiation ability.
	Highly organized, detail-oriented, and process-driven.


Salary

Role Summary


	The Procurement Executive will support all procurement operations in Nigeria, ensuring smooth documentation, vendor coordination, and internal process compliance.
	The role requires strong commercial understanding, document management skills, and the ability to work efficiently with local vendors and cross-functional teams.


Key Responsibilities
Documentation & Process Management:


	Prepare, review, and raise all procurement documents including PRs, POs, GRNs, service orders, and supplier onboarding forms.
	Maintain accurate documentation and ensure all records are updated in the internal tracking systems.
	Ensure compliance with procurement SOPs, approval matrix, and audit requirements.
	Manage procurement trackers, including PO tracker, invoice tracker, delivery tracker, and price master.


Vendor Management (Nigeria Market):


	Act as the primary contact for local vendors and suppliers in Nigeria.
	Source, evaluate, and communicate with vendors to obtain quotations, negotiate basic terms, and ensure timely delivery.
	Maintain updated vendor database, rate contracts, and product catalogues.


Internal Stakeholder Coordination:


	Work closely with Operations, Finance, Logistics, Projects, and Warehouse teams to understand procurement needs.
	Coordinate for PR approvals, delivery schedules, material requirements, and invoice processing.
	Support the Associate Director – Procurement in executing procurement strategies for Nigeria.


Invoice & Payment Reconciliation:


	Verify supplier invoices against POs, delivery notes, and contracts.
	Resolve discrepancies in quantity, pricing, and documentation with vendors and internal teams.
	Ensure timely submission of complete documents to Finance for payment processing.


Reporting & Analysis:


	
	Maintain weekly/monthly procurement MIS and dashboards.
	
	
	Track savings, lead times, supplier performance, and procurement KPIs.
	
	Escalate delays, vendor issues, and critical requirements to the Associate Director – Procurement.


Qualifications
Required Skills & Attributes:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business Administration, Engineering, or related field.
	2–4 years of procurement or supply chain experience (preferably in the Nigerian market).
	Understanding of local Nigerian business culture, communication norms, and procurement practices.
	Basic knowledge of commercial terms, import/export documentation, and taxation (added advantage).
	Strong MS Excel, documentation, and tracking skills.
	Excellent communication and negotiation ability.
	Highly organized, detail-oriented, and process-driven.


Salary
Negotiable based on experience.
